Avon: Mary Kay, and Estée Lauder have not resumed testing their products on animals in the U.S.
The rumor claiming that Avon: Mary Kay, and Estée Lauder had resumed animal testing started circulating on social media sites, stemming from an article published by the Dog Files web site in 2012.
PETA removed Avon: Mary Kay, and Estée Lauder from their cruelty-free list after discovering that they had returned to using testing on animals for their products.
